values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm not against this, I just have a question inline that I want to make sure a core looks at.

You're right that we need to make a change along these lines.  The deprecation Julien is talking about is here: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/ac0e28b4d83c35e86e493e8f472537b4127b0c7e/oslo_utils/timeutils.py#L72

I just wonder whether we need to go with using .strftime() instead with a specific format string instead of using .isotime(), because it looks like .isotime() is going to change way time is displayed in some API responses.

Patch Set 1:

I don't think strftime is a good idea. However, it might be better to use timestamps with timezone information if that's needed.

Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I'm not sure what the best thing to do is here.  Added a bunch of senior Glance people to the review to get their opinions.

Patch Set 1:

We could use `strftime` with https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/ac0e28b4d83c35e86e493e8f472537b4127b0c7e/oslo_utils/timeutils.py#L36. That would mean we get the benefit of what timeutils used to provide us with the certainty we won't be breaking backwards compat, I think.

Patch Set 1:

I don't think the format is changed, it's still ISO8601 compliant with more precise data.

If you want to go ahead and switch to strftime() go ahead and change that patch. I don't feel like doing all of that again for that.

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

There's more precision in the seconds field, but the "Z" at the end (indicating UTC) is gone. Could the removal of that information cause any problems? Some program might instead parse the date/time output as being local time instead of UTC.

Patch Set 1:

Folks, next week's releases for oslo *will* break glance. so please bump up the priority of this review.

Patch Set 1:

Yeah, the Z is missing because the datetime objects are not carrying any timezone information. That's something that should be fixed in Glance IMHO.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Unless I'm missing something, this change won't break clients since it still uses iso8601 compliant dates. Other than changing the displayed date, I think there's no big change here.

+2'ing for now but do block it if you feel like I'm missing something here.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Like Brian and Drew pointed out this is indeed API breaking change for us. Our API documentation clearly specifies the format our time is presented without microseconds and including the utc offset: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-image-v2.html

Lets figure out how we prevent oslo breaking us here without breaking out own API by doing so.

Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Removed my +2.

Erno, could you take this on and help moving this patch forward?

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Yup, looking into it
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

I agree with the decision to take over the timeutils, particularly given the short time to get this done.

Patch Set 5: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.

Patch Set 5:

"I agree with the decision to take over the timeutils, particularly given the short time to get this done."

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/5cad113739fa906c3901e530fcbfdee3b48961c1

Deprecated for 7 months.

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

FWIW I think this is a terrible patch. You're just duplicating the whole oslo codebase for no good reason, rather than fixing Glance code.

Patch Set 5:

Julien, not "whole oslo codebase" only the bits from timeutils we are using, btw which of 80% is under deprecation, and this approach does not break our API like yours. It was way cleaner to pull those bits in to our tree as oslo does not want to maintain them as they seemed to be the cleanest way to do what we need, we could have rewrote that or replicate those bits of code all over our codebase, but why should we?
Uploaded patch set 6.

Patch Set 6:

@Brian: It was a rebase as I probably pushed PS5 with an old tree.
Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Only +1 since I contributed to the patch.
Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

With the short time scale and to maintain our API I am in favour of this patch.

Patch Set 6:

Just want to follow up on Julien's point that the short time frame is largely of the Glance community's own making. I didn't mean to imply earlier that it was the Oslo community's fault.  And I want to add a link to the ML discussion of how we can avert such a problem in the future.  The thread starts with this message: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/081833.html

Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks, Julien. Also, thanks, Erno!
